title.narrative: Raising awareness workshop of editors-in-chief and/or publication directors of media mainstream in Cote d'Ivoire

description.narrative: (i) increasing their sense of their social responsibilities towards the women’s rights of expression, their female audiences rights to access to information; (ii) developing their knowledge about what gender sensitive journalism is; iii) strengthening their capacity to coach their journalists on gender-sensitive journalism, (iv) disseminating the gender sensitivity methodology of their teams within the editorial newsroom

As results. 13 editors-in-chief sensitized on gender sensitiv reporting. 85% of them had a better knowledge of the general framework of women's rights in Côte d'Ivoire. All the participant significantly improved the level of knowledge and understanding of gender-sensitive journalism. They validated the follow-up plan for productions produced by journalists during their training

The training workshop was conducted by journalism and gender experts, and had two components: A thematic session was held about the general context of Violence against women and women political participation in Cote d'Ivoire; and a technical section on gender-sensitive journalism, its issues and characteristics.

participating-org.narrative: Ministery of Foreign Affairs of The Netherlands
